panels.description:
Partition usage, disk reading, disk writing, download bandwidth, upload bandwidth, if there are multiple network cards or multiple partitions, it is the value of the network card or partition with the highest usage rate collected.

Number of connections: CurrEstab - Number of TCP connections with current status ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT.

The health value is a new indicator. A value calculated based on CPU, memory, and IO, which is less than 90 points, indicates that the system's resource usage needs to be paid attention to. This is an indicator being tested, and the parameters may need to be optimized according to the actual situation.
System uptime
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Average CPU usage percentage across all cores over the last 5 minutes.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Current number of established TCP connections on the node.
panels.title: Total connection

panels.description: Total number of CPU cores
panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: Total RAM
panels.title: RAM Total

panels.description: Percentage of memory currently used on the node.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description:
Shows the total physical memory (RAM) available.

Used memory on the node excluding memory used for caches, buffers, and reclaimable slab memory â€” effectively the memory actively used by processes
panels.title: Memory Basic

panels.description:
Displays the total amount of swap memory available on the node.
Displays the total amount of swap memory used on the node.
panels.title: Swap Memory Used

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted
panels.title: Disk Space Used

panels.description: current rate of disk reads and write in bytes per second (B/s)
panels.title: Disk Read Write

panels.description: The number (after merges) of I/O requests completed per second for the device
panels.title: Disk IOps Completed

panels.description:
Read time seconds The number of seconds the read operation takes per disk partition

Write time seconds The number of seconds the write operation per disk partition is taken
panels.title: Time to read and write each IO (reference: less than 100ms)

panels.description:
Shows the incoming network bandwidth in bits per second (bps) over the last 5 minutes.
It calculates how much data the node is receiving across all interfaces.

Shows the outgoing network bandwidth in bits per second (bps) over the last 5 minutes.
It reflects how much data the node is sending out.
panels.title: Use $device per second network bandwidth

panels.description:
Shows the 1-minute load average â€” the average number of runnable processes over the last minute.

Displays the 5-minute load average â€” smoother than 1-minute, good for short-term trends.

Shows the 15-minute load average â€” best for viewing long-term CPU load trends.
panels.title: System average load

panels.description:
Shows the total number of sockets (TCP, UDP, etc.) currently in use on the selected node.
This gives an overview of how many network connections or endpoints are actively being used by the system.
panels.title: Sockstat Used

panels.description:
Shows the number of TCP sockets allocated.

Displays the number of TCP sockets currently in use.

Shows the amount of memory (in pages) used by TCP sockets.

Displays the number of TCP sockets in TIME_WAIT state â€” meaning the connection was closed but is still waiting to ensure the remote side received the final ACK.

targets.legendFormat: TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use

panels.title: Sockstat TCP

panels.description:
Shows the number of UDPLite sockets currently in use.

Shows the number of active UDP sockets currently in use.

Shows the amount of memory (in pages) used by all UDP sockets.

targets.legendFormat: UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use
UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use

panels.title: Sockstat UDP

panels.description: Number of processes in the group.
panels.title: Number Processes

panels.description: Actual memory usage by the process.
panels.title: Resident Memory

panels.description: CPU usage as a percentage of total CPU cores

targets.expr:
topk(5,sum(irate(namedprocess_namegroup_cpu_seconds_total{instance=~"$Process_instance", job="process_exporter"}[1m])) by (groupname)
> 0)
/
scalar(
  count(
    count(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance=~"$Node_instance", job="node_exporter"}) by (cpu)
  )
)

panels.title: %CPU by services

panels.description:
Calculates the per-second CPU usage per process group.
The metric is a counter that represents the total CPU time consumed by a process group in seconds.
panels.title: CPU (millicore)

panels.description: Current number of threads used by each process group.
panels.title: Number Threads

panels.description:
USED - Number of currently open file descriptors by the process.
MAX-The maximum number of file descriptors the process is allowed to open (soft limit).
panels.title: Total File Descriptors

panels.description: The number of bytes written by the group.
panels.title: Write Bytes

panels.description: A cumulative counter for the number of bytes read by each process group.
panels.title: Read Bytes

panels.description: Cumulative counter of major page faults per process group.
panels.title: Major Page Faults

panels.description: A minor page fault happens when a process accesses a memory page that is not in its working set but is already in RAM â€” so it doesn't require disk access.
panels.title: Minor Page Faults
